doc.field: Records of the School of Global Public Health
Records of the School of Global Public Health
The School of Global Public Health was established in 2015. In 2017, the I AM GPH podcast was started. The collection contains the website and audio recordings of the podcast.
The School of Global Public Health was established in 2015. In 2017, the I AM GPH podcast was started. The collection contains the website and audio recordings of the podcast.

The collection contains the websites for the I AM GPH podcast created by the School of Global Public Health (GPH). I AM GPH focuses on conversations between students, faculty, and alumni in the GPH community. The page also contains the 5% and Falling podcast series on public health crises and the Healthright Frontline Health Workers podcast series--a four-part series created by I AM GPH and Healthright International profiling four front-line health workers in Odessa, Ukraine; New York; northern Uganda; and eastern Kenya. The collection also includes YouTube videos of the podcast dating from December 2022.

The School of Global Public Health grew out of a Master of Public Health program at School of Education, Health, Nursing and Arts Professions (SEHNAP) starting in 1987. In 2006, a University-wide master's of public health (MPH) degree program was founded. In 2008, the Steinhardt School established a Bachelor of Science in Public Health. In 2011, the University-wide MPH and Steinhardt's MPH consolidated into the Global Institute of Public Health (GIPH). It established the Epidemiology; Biostatistics; Environmental Public Health Sciences; Public Health Policy & Management; and Social and Behavioral Sciences departments and the Center for Bioethics transferred from Arts and Sciences from 2013-2016. By 2015, the College of Global Public Health was formally established. In late 2019, it changed its name to the School of Global Public Health. In 2017, the school started a podcast entitled I AM GPH.

https://publichealth.nyu.edu/events-news-media/public-health-podcasts was selected by curators and captured through the use of Archive-It in July 2018. Archive-It uses web crawling technology to capture websites at a scheduled time and displays only an archived copy, from the resulting WARC file, of the website. In February 2021, https://publichealth.nyu.edu/hrpodcast/ was added to capture all podcasts. The accession number associated with this website is 2021.059. In 2023, https://iamgph.libsyn.com/ and https://publichealth.nyu.edu/events-news/public-health-podcasts/ was added. The accession number associated with these websites is 2023.012. In March 2024, https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLOQ5BUixcbQSQndTmaqHo2tHHWuml0Lp2 was added. The accession number associated with this website is 2024.021. In April 2024, https://publichealth.nyu.edu/events/public-health-podcasts was added. The accession number associated with this website is 2024.027.

Archived websites are made accessible for purposes of education and research. NYU Libraries have given attribution to rights holders when possible; however, due to the nature of archival collections, we are not always able to identify this information.
If you hold the rights to materials in our archived websites that are unattributed, please let us know so that we may maintain accurate information about these materials.

If you are a rights holder and are concerned that you have found material on this website for which you have not granted permission (or is not covered by a copyright exception under US copyright laws), you may request the removal of the material from our site by submitting a notice, with the elements described below, to the special.collections@nyu.edu.

Please include the following in your notice: Identification of the material that you believe to be infringing and information sufficient to permit us to locate the material; your contact information, such as an address, telephone number, and email address; a statement that you are the owner, or authorized to act on behalf of the owner, of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed and that you have a good-faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law; a statement that the information in the notification is accurate and made under penalty of perjury; and your physical or electronic signature. Upon receiving a notice that includes the details listed above, we will remove the allegedly infringing material from public view while we assess the issues identified in your notice.

Crawl was limited to domains of publichealth.nyu.edu/events-news-media/public-health-podcasts, publichealth.nyu.edu/podcast/iamgph, and publichealth.nyu.edu/hrpodcast in order to remain within the collection scope and data constraints.

Due to technical or privacy issues, archived websites may not be exact copies of the original website at the time of the web crawl. Certain file types will not be captured dependent on how they are embedded in the site. Other parts of websites that the crawler has difficulty capturing includes Javascript, streaming content, database-driven content, and highly interactive content. Full-Text searches of archived websites are available at https://archive-it.org/organizations/567.
